Message: The user completes the submission of the form
optimizing performance

To optimize the performance of your ads on NewsBreak, we recommend using our native strategy. This means providing us with your ad assets, and we will decide when and where to run them to drive optimized performance. For more details, you can check out this article: [Types of NewsBreak Ad Formats and Placements](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/20229876903053-Types-of-NewsBreak-Ad-Formats-and-Placements).
high cpa adset optimize

To optimize a high CPA (Cost Per Acquisition) ad set on NewsBreak, you can try the following strategies:
1. **Review Targeting:** Ensure your targeting is precise and relevant to your audience.
2. **Creative Testing:** Test different creatives to see which ones perform better.
3. **Bid Adjustments:** Adjust your bids to find the optimal balance between cost and performance.
4. **Landing Page Optimization:** Make sure your landing page is optimized for conversions.
5. **Use Separate Ad Accounts:** If you have multiple offers or verticals, use separate ad accounts for each to optimize performance.
For more detailed guidance, you can refer to this article: [How to create your first ad](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/17618196971149-How-to-create-your-first-ad).
should you start campaign with max conversion

Starting a campaign with Max Conversion can be a good strategy, especially if you're looking to prioritize volume. Here are some tips:
1. **Start with a Smaller Daily Budget:** Begin with a daily budget that is 5-10x your CPA goal.
2. **Monitor Performance:** Keep an eye on the performance during the learning phase and make adjustments as needed.
3. **Switch to tCPA if Needed:** If your CPA becomes higher than the goal, consider switching to Target CPA (tCPA) with a daily budget at least 10x your tCPA rate.
For more detailed best practices, you can check out this article: [tCPA Best Practices](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/18020232662797-tCPA-Best-Practices).
how many creatives to add in 1 adset

For optimal performance, we recommend adding 2-3 creatives per ad set. This allows you to test different variations and see which ones perform best without overwhelming the system. Make sure to monitor their performance and make adjustments as needed.
For more detailed guidance, you can refer to this article: [Maximize Conversions Best Practices](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/23055076590221-Maximize-Conversions-Best-Practices).
should you put video and image in same adset

It's generally recommended not to mix video and image creatives in the same ad set. Instead, separate them into different ad sets to better analyze their performance individually. This helps in understanding which format works best for your audience.
For more detailed guidance, you can refer to this article: [Ad Creative Best Practices and A/B Testing](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/20676690598029-Ad-Creative-Best-Practices-and-A-B-Testing).
should you add new ad during learning phase

It's generally not recommended to add new ads during the learning phase. The learning phase, also known as the Cold Start Period, typically lasts 2-5 days and is crucial for gathering data about user behavior. Making changes during this time can disrupt the learning process and lead to inaccurate performance data.
For more detailed guidance, you can refer to this article: [tCPA Best Practices](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/18020232662797-tCPA-Best-Practices).
2 conversions after testing 5 days

If you've only achieved 2 conversions after testing for 5 days, it might be time to make some adjustments. Here are a few steps you can take:
1. **Review Your Targeting:** Ensure your targeting is precise and relevant to your audience.
2. **Creative Testing:** Test different creatives to see which ones perform better.
3. **Bid Adjustments:** Adjust your bids to find the optimal balance between cost and performance.
4. **Increase Budget Gradually:** Consider increasing your budget gradually to gather more data.
5. **Optimize Landing Page:** Make sure your landing page is optimized for conversions.
For more detailed guidance, you can refer to this article: [Maximize Conversions Best Practices](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/23055076590221-Maximize-Conversions-Best-Practices).
can you pause ads and add new ads after 5 days of testing during learning phase

It's generally not recommended to pause ads or add new ads during the learning phase, as this can disrupt the system's ability to gather accurate performance data. The learning phase typically lasts around 20-30 conversions, and making changes too early can extend this period.
For more detailed guidance, you can refer to this article: [Maximize Conversions Best Practices](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/23055076590221-Maximize-Conversions-Best-Practices).
how many creatives can you ad per adset of $200/day budget

For an ad set with a $200/day budget, we recommend adding 2-3 creatives. This allows you to test different variations and see which ones perform best without overwhelming the system.
For more detailed guidance, you can refer to this article: [Maximize Conversions Best Practices](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/23055076590221-Maximize-Conversions-Best-Practices).
can video and gif ad be in same adset

It's generally recommended to separate different types of creatives, such as videos and GIFs, into different ad sets. This allows for better performance analysis and optimization for each creative type.
For more detailed guidance, you can refer to this article: [Ad Creative Best Practices and A/B Testing](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/20676690598029-Ad-Creative-Best-Practices-and-A-B-Testing).
should horizontal and vertical video be in same adset

It's generally recommended to separate horizontal and vertical videos into different ad sets. This allows for better performance analysis and optimization for each video format.
For more detailed guidance, you can refer to this article: [Ad Creative Best Practices and A/B Testing](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/20676690598029-Ad-Creative-Best-Practices-and-A-B-Testing).
does video perform better than image ad

Whether video performs better than image ads can depend on various factors such as the target audience, the creative quality, and the campaign goals. Generally, videos tend to have higher engagement rates because they are more dynamic and can convey more information in a shorter time. However, it's essential to test both formats to see which one works best for your specific campaign.
For more detailed guidance, you can refer to this article: [Ad Creative Best Practices and A/B Testing](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/20676690598029-Ad-Creative-Best-Practices-and-A-B-Testing).
does video or gif perform better

The performance of videos versus GIFs can vary depending on the context and audience. Generally, videos tend to have higher engagement rates because they can convey more information and are more dynamic. However, GIFs can be effective for quick, eye-catching content that grabs attention. It's best to test both formats to see which one resonates more with your audience.
For more detailed guidance, you can refer to this article: [Ad Creative Best Practices and A/B Testing](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/20676690598029-Ad-Creative-Best-Practices-and-A-B-Testing).
max time and size of video creative upload

The maximum length for video creatives on NewsBreak is typically 30 seconds, but longer videos can be used if they are driving users to a Video Sales Letter (VSL). The maximum file size for video uploads is generally 1GB.
For more detailed guidance, you can refer to this article: [Ad Creative Best Practices and A/B Testing](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/20676690598029-Ad-Creative-Best-Practices-and-A-B-Testing).
max size and time of gif upload

The maximum file size for GIF uploads on NewsBreak is generally 1GB. As for the duration, GIFs should be kept short and engaging, typically no longer than 15 seconds to ensure they capture attention quickly.
For more detailed guidance, you can refer to this article: [Ad Creative Best Practices and A/B Testing](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/20676690598029-Ad-Creative-Best-Practices-and-A-B-Testing).
recommended frequency cap

The recommended frequency cap can vary depending on your campaign goals and audience. However, a common practice is to set a frequency cap of 1-2 impressions per user per day. This helps ensure that your ads are seen enough to make an impact without overwhelming the audience.
For more detailed guidance, you can refer to this article: [Ad Creative Best Practices and A/B Testing](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/20676690598029-Ad-Creative-Best-Practices-and-A-B-Testing).
